title: Test: Chat - customize font family/size in the chat panel
body:
Refs: <!-- Refer to the issue that this test plan item is testing. -->

- [x] macOS @jo-oikawa
- [x] linux @justschen
- [x] windows @mjbvz

Complexity: 3


[Create Issue](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/new?template=blank&body=Testing+%23264323%0A%0A&assignees=lszomoru)

---

This milestone we have added the capability to customize the font family (`chat.fontFamily`) and size (`chat.fontSize`) of the markdown text as well as **many** of the UI elements in the chat panel (ex: file pills, tool calls, etc.). ℹ️ It is very important to call out that any lists that are being shown in the chat panel will not be scaled up/down as the settings are being updated.  

### Prerequisites
* Install latest VS Code Insiders release
* Install latest Copilot Chat pre-release extension
* Reset the values of the `chat.fontFamily`, `chat.fontSize` settings

### Test plan
* Open a folder/workspace in VS Code
* Open the chat panel, use the "Show Chats..." actions in the chat panel title to open multiple chat settings that contain various content
* Open Settings and modify the `chat.fontFamily` and `chat.fontSize` settings to customize the text rendering in the chat panel
    * Confirm that the rendering is updated in the Chat panel
    * Share screenshots of any UI (except lists!) that does not get updated when the settings are changed

title: Usage indicator does not reset at start of new month due to timezone mismatch
body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ --> <!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ --> <!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions --> <!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. --> <!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

Problem:
There is a timezone inconsistency between the Premium requests usage indicator and the allowance reset date in the Copilot Usage panel. When the new month starts (e.g., October 1st), the indicator may continue to show usage from the previous month (e.g., September), even though the usage allowance has already reset.
This occurs when the user's local timezone is ahead of the Microsoft Copilot server time. For example:

User in Germany (UTC+2) observes that on October 1st, 10:00 AM local time (08:00 UTC), the usage panel still shows prior month's usage, even though the reset has happened on the server (October 1st, 00:00 UTC).

Root Cause:
The quota usage calculation in ChatQuotaService only relied on the server's percent_remaining value and did not check if the reported usage period matched the user's current local time, resulting in stale data after allowance resets.

Steps to Reproduce:

- Be located in a timezone ahead of UTC (e.g., Germany, UTC+2).
- Open Copilot Usage panel shortly after a new allowance period should start (e.g., October 1st, after the UTC reset).
- Observe that the usage indicator still reflects last month's usage rather than resetting.

Expected Behavior:
Usage indicator should display 0% usage at the start of the new month after the allowance has reset, regardless of the user's timezone.

Fix implemented:
A timezone-aware usage computation that detects and resets stale data after the new quota period begins has been proposed in [PR #1](https://github.com/ahmad-salah94/vscode-copilot-chat/pull/1).
This fix resets the indicator when evidence of stale usage is detected post-reset, while preserving normal calculation under all other conditions.

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled? Yes

title: Test: Git - update chat working set for various UI gestures
body:
Refs: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/262595

- [x] anyOS @sbatten
- [x] anyOS @benibenj

Complexity: 2


[Create Issue](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/new?template=blank&body=Testing+%23264317%0A%0A&assignees=lszomoru)

---

This milestone we have added code that would auto-keep/auto-undo your changes in the chat panel working set specific source control actions are taken - staging, committing will auto-keep, while discarding changes will auto-undo the changes in the chat panel working set.

### Prerequisites
* Install the latest VS Code Insiders release
* Install the latest Copilot Chat pre-release extension 

### Stage changes
* Open a folder/workspace that contains a git repository
* Open the chat panel, switch to agent mode and send a prompt that will result in a file change
    * Confirm that the working set contains one changed file (collapsed by default)
* Open the Source Control view and stage the change
    * Confirm that the file is gone from the working set

### Commit changes
* Open a folder/workspace that contains a git repository
* Open the chat panel, switch to agent mode and send a prompt that will result in a file change
    * Confirm that the working set contains one changed file (collapsed by default)
* Open the Source Control view and commit the change
    * Confirm that the file is gone from the working set

### Discard changes
* Open a folder/workspace that contains a git repository
* Open the chat panel, switch to agent mode and send a prompt that will result in a file change
    * Confirm that the working set contains one changed file (collapsed by default)
* Open the Source Control view and discard the changes on the modified file
    * Confirm that the file is gone from the working set

title: August 2025 Endgame

labels.name: endgame-plan
labels.description: VS Code - Next release plan for endgame

body:
<!--
!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
!!                                WARNING                                     !!
!!                                                                            !!
!! DO NOT COPY/PASTE THIS TEMPLATE TO CREATE AN ENDGAME PLAN MANUALLY.        !!
!! Instead, use https://tools.code.visualstudio.com/duties/endgame to create  !!
!! the endgame plan automatically.                                            !!
!! For more information check                                                 !!
!! https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Running-the-Endgame               !!
!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
-->

**Sometimes we have slight adjustments to the endgame plan to account for local holidays. Please update your endgame plan accordingly.**

<!-- Do not change the format of the following text as it is parsed by VS Code Tools to extract endgame schedule -->
- *September 1, 2025* Code freeze for the endgame
- *September 2, 2025* [Endgame starts](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Development-Process#inside-an-iteration)
- *September 5, 2025* Endgame done
- *September 10, 2025* Expected release date (this may change)

##### Monday

- [x] Pin endgame issue on GitHub **@sandy081**
- [x] Assess public holidays and adjust the endgame plan accordingly to ensure that announcements are made when the team can respond to them. **@sandy081**
- [x] Run [OSS tool](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-build-tools/tree/main/distro-tools) **@sandy081**
- [x] Update links in the [Endgame notebooks](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/main/.vscode/notebooks/endgame.github-issues) to point to new milestone **@sandy081**
- [x] Code freeze at 9pm CET, PRs should no longer be accepted to ensure a green build
- [x] Ensure we have a green build on all platforms at 9pm CET
- [x] [🔖Ensure all closed feature-requests](https://github.com/issues?q=org%3Amicrosoft%20is%3Aclosed%20is%3Aissue%20milestone%3A%22August%202025%22%20label%3Afeature-request%20-label%3Averification-needed%20-label%3Aon-testplan%20-label%3Averified%20-label%3A*duplicate%20-label%3A*as-designed%20-label%3A*out-of-scope) either have a `verification-needed` or `on-testplan` label
- [x] Create test plan items following the template [here](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Writing-Test-Plan-Items) by 6pm PT
  - [x] Remind the team that TPIs should be written so that anyone can test. If this is not feasible, then TPI authors should assign specific testers **@sandy081**
- [x] Update your availability for testing here - https://tools.code.visualstudio.com/team-manifest **team**
  - [x] Double check N/A testers. **@sandy081**
  - [x] Remind team that in the event of sickness or overload with TPIs, to inform the endgame champ ASAP so items can be reassigned
- [x] Remind team to go through their fixed issues for the milestone and update repro steps for issues which require more detailed instructions.
- [x] Set up the endgame retrospective to discuss process improvement
  - Schedule an endgame restrospective with endgame champion, endgame buddy, and next endgame champion for late debt week
  - [Create the endgame retrospective tracking issue](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-internalbacklog/issues/new?template=endgame-retrospective.md)
- [x] Set up a standup meeting for Friday to discuss candidates

##### Tuesday

- [x] Test plan items assigned (using https://tools.code.visualstudio.com/test-plan-items)
  - Run the tool multiple times to balance load if test items come in later and assignments are already made
  - [Assigned to you](https://github.com/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+assignee%3A%40me++label%3Atestplan-item+)
- [x] Test build starts at 7am CET
- [x] Test plan ready by 8am CET
- [x] Remind the team about the priorities
  - Tuesday should be dedicated _exclusively_ to testing activities. Our goal is to ensure the completion of all Test Plan Items (TPIs) and subsequently proceed with the verification phase. Fixes or commits should be refrained from unless there are exceptional circumstances such as blocked TPIs or build-related issues. On Tuesday Redmond EOD, only blocked TPIs should remain open with a corresponding label `blocked` and status update comment in the issue.
- [x] Testing and Verification 
  - [x] [🔖Testing](https://github.com/issues?q=org%3Amicrosoft%20is%3Aopen%20is%3Aissue%20milestone%3A%22August%202025%22%20label%3Atestplan-item)
  - [x] [🔖Verification of Bugs Reported by me](https://github.com/issues?q=org%3Amicrosoft%20is%3Aclosed%20is%3Aissue%20milestone%3A%22August%202025%22%20author%3A%40me%20-label%3Aiteration-plan%20-label%3Aendgame-plan%20-label%3Atestplan-item%20-label%3A*duplicate%20-label%3Ainvalid%20-label%3A*as-designed%20-label%3Aerror-telemetry%20-label%3Averified%20-label%3Aon-testplan%20label%3Abug)
  - [x] [🔖Verification needed](https://github.com/issues?q=org%3Amicrosoft%20is%3Aclosed%20is%3Aissue%20milestone%3A%22August%202025%22%20-label%3Aiteration-plan%20-label%3Aendgame-plan%20-label%3Atestplan-item%20-label%3A*duplicate%20-label%3Aon-testplan%20-label%3Averified%20label%3Averification-needed)
  - [x] [🔖Verification](https://github.com/issues?q=org%3Amicrosoft%20is%3Aclosed%20is%3Aissue%20milestone%3A%22August%202025%22%20-label%3Aiteration-plan%20-label%3Aendgame-plan%20-label%3Atestplan-item%20-label%3A*duplicate%20-label%3Ainvalid%20-label%3A*as-designed%20-label%3Aerror-telemetry%20-label%3Averified%20-label%3Aon-testplan%20label%3Abug) (If verification needed is finished)


##### Wednesday

- [x] [🔖Testing](https://github.com/issues?q=org%3Amicrosoft%20is%3Aopen%20is%3Aissue%20milestone%3A%22August%202025%22%20label%3Atestplan-item)
  - These remaining TPIs should be the ones that are currently blocked. Discuss during the standup and redistribute assignments based on the TPI owner and the test coverage. For instance, if a TPI is owned by a member from Zurich and has not undergone sufficient testing, it will be reassigned to one of the Zurich team members.
- [x] Remind team members to triage issues found in testing and assign major issues that they intend to fix to the current milestone. Remind team to move out or close other open issues/PRs on the milestone that they do not intend to fix this milestone.
- [x] [🔖Verification needed](https://github.com/issues?q=org%3Amicrosoft%20is%3Aclosed%20is%3Aissue%20milestone%3A%22August%202025%22%20-label%3Aiteration-plan%20-label%3Aendgame-plan%20-label%3Atestplan-item%20-label%3A*duplicate%20-label%3Aon-testplan%20-label%3Averified%20label%3Averification-needed)
- [x] Fixing (self-assigned, milestone assigned)
- [x] [🔖Verification](https://github.com/issues?q=org%3Amicrosoft%20is%3Aclosed%20is%3Aissue%20milestone%3A%22August%202025%22%20-label%3Aiteration-plan%20-label%3Aendgame-plan%20-label%3Atestplan-item%20-label%3A*duplicate%20-label%3Ainvalid%20-label%3A*as-designed%20-label%3Aerror-telemetry%20-label%3Averified%20-label%3Aon-testplan%20label%3Abug)
- [x] Message team members as needed to add steps to `verification-steps-needed` issues **@sandy081**

##### Thursday

- [x] Make sure the `insider` build is green **@sandy081**
- [x] Fixing (self-assigned, milestone assigned)
  - Increased scrutiny sets in due to testing being completed. Fixes pose a much higher risk
  - Move open issues/PRs to the next month that can be deferred
- [x] Emphasize to the team that we want to verify as many issues as we can before the branching time, and ping team members as needed to remind them to add steps to `verification-steps-needed` issues  **@sandy081**
- [x] [🔖Verification needed](https://github.com/issues?q=org%3Amicrosoft%20is%3Aclosed%20is%3Aissue%20milestone%3A%22August%202025%22%20-label%3Aiteration-plan%20-label%3Aendgame-plan%20-label%3Atestplan-item%20-label%3A*duplicate%20-label%3Aon-testplan%20-label%3Averified%20label%3Averification-needed)
- [x] [🔖Verification](https://github.com/issues?q=org%3Amicrosoft%20is%3Aclosed%20is%3Aissue%20milestone%3A%22August%202025%22%20-label%3Aiteration-plan%20-label%3Aendgame-plan%20-label%3Atestplan-item%20-label%3A*duplicate%20-label%3Ainvalid%20-label%3A*as-designed%20-label%3Aerror-telemetry%20-label%3Averified%20-label%3Aon-testplan%20label%3Abug)
- [x] Fix any issues regarding new undocumented colors. **@sandy081**
  - [x] In the vscode-docs repo, merge the `main` branch into `vnext`
  - [x] Run `scripts/test-documentation.sh|bat` after compiling the vscode repo, and fix any issues regarding new undocumented colors. Changes made to the vscode-docs repository must be merged to the main branch of that repository for the script to acknowledge them. False positives within the `color` section in `vscode-known-variables.json` can be moved under the `others` section of that file.
- [x] Ensure [Copilot Chat CG](https://dev.azure.com/monacotools/Monaco/_componentGovernance/207009) is happy **@sandy081**
- [x] Ensure the [Copilot Chat CI / Build](https://dev.azure.com/monacotools/Monaco/_build?definitionId=500) is green **@sandy081**
- [x] Test upgrading from last month's VS Code and release Copilot Chat extension to this month's. **@sandy081**

##### Thursday/Friday - Depending on @sandy081 timezone

- [x] Make sure the `insider` build is green **@sandy081**
- [x] By Thursday EOD (Redmond) or Friday BOD (Zurich), branch from `main` and release **@sandy081**
  - [x] Run [OSS tool](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-build-tools/tree/main/distro-tools) once again from `main` to ensure picking up any dependency license changes **@sandy081**
  - [x] [Disable continuous `insider` builds](https://builds.code.visualstudio.com/builds/insider) and announce in `#release`
  - [x] Branch following repositories to `release/<x.y>`.
    - [x] vscode
    - [x] vscode-distro
    - [x] vscode-dev
  - [x] Bump up the version in `package.json` on `main` & run `npm i` to bump `package-lock.json` as well. **@sandy081**
  - [x] Branch `vscode-copilot-chat` **@sandy081**
    - [x] Create new release branch with format `release/<version>` where `<version>` is `0.X` from `package.json`
    - [x] Bump the minor version number in `main` to the next monthly version (bump `X` in `0.X.0`), run `npm install` to update `package-lock.json`
  - [x] Announce `main` is open for business, and all issues on the current iteration should now be candidates that need to follow the candidate release process.
  - [x] Localization: Run [Update VS Code Branch](https://monacotools.visualstudio.com/Monaco/_build?definitionId=369) build with `release/*` as the VS Code Branch parameter (it's the default so you shouldn't have to change anything)
  - [x] Trigger the [⭐️ VS Code](https://dev.azure.com/monacotools/Monaco/_build?definitionId=111) pipeline from `release/<x.y>`, with the `insiders` Quality and enable `Release build if successful`.
  - [x] Trigger the [[vscode.dev] 🚀 Deploy](https://dev.azure.com/monacotools/Monaco/_build?definitionId=276) pipeline from `release/<x.y>`, with the `insiders` Deployment Target.
  - [x] Announce in `#release` **@sandy081**
    > :loudspeaker: Extension authors ensure all release branch changes have been published to users, manually building and releasing if necessary.
- [x] Build but don't release a `stable` build from release/<x.y> branch to ensure stable build is green **@sandy081**
- [x] [Create next milestone](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/milestones/new) on `microsoft/vscode` repo and ensure that it has a due date. The created milestone and its due date will be automatically synced across our repos. **@sandy081**

##### Friday

- [x] Only candidate issues are open and assigned to [🔖milestone](https://github.com/issues?q=org%3Amicrosoft%20is%3Aopen%20is%3Aissue%20milestone%3A%22August%202025%22)
- [x] All issues [🔖verified](https://github.com/issues?q=org%3Amicrosoft%20is%3Aclosed%20is%3Aissue%20milestone%3A%22August%202025%22%20-label%3Aiteration-plan%20-label%3Aendgame-plan%20-label%3Atestplan-item%20-label%3A*duplicate%20-label%3Ainvalid%20-label%3A*as-designed%20-label%3Aerror-telemetry%20-label%3Averified%20-label%3Aon-testplan%20label%3Abug)
- [x] All open PRs on the milestone [🔖merged or deferred](https://github.com/issues?q=org%3Amicrosoft%20is%3Aopen%20is%3Apr%20milestone%3A%22August%202025%22)
- [x] Fix [`candidate` issues](https://github.com/issues?q=org%3Amicrosoft%20is%3Aissue%20is%3Aopen%20milestone%3A%22August%202025%22%20label%3Acandidate) (major bugs only)
  - Discuss and get approval in stand up
  - Review and merge into `release/<x.y>`
  - [Queue new auto-published insiders build](https://monacotools.visualstudio.com/Monaco/_build?definitionId=111) as candidates are merged **@sandy081** 
  - Author of candidate PR should find verifier
- Satellite modules/npm packages ready, version updated, smoke tested
  - [x] yo generator **@aeschli**
  - [x] js-debug **@connor4312**
  - [x] Debug Adapter Protocol **@connor4312**
  - [x] vscode-debugadapter-node **@connor4312**
  - [x] vscode-test-web **@aeschli**
- [x] All release notes updated
  - release notes are collected in a file named _`v<Major>_<Minor>.md`\_ in this [repo directory](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-docs/blob/vnext/release-notes/)
  - Release notes screen recording guidance: https://microsoft-my.sharepoint.com/:p:/p/buhollan/Ecg_j89jzlVGtfqWGy7SQBEB_OsuLPZ65jjKRVlo_OdlgA
- [x] Documentation added or updated
- [x] [Acknowledge third-party pull requests](https://tools.code.visualstudio.com/acknowledgement) in release notes. **@sandy081**
- [x] Acknowledge [issue trackers](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-internalbacklog/wiki/Community-Triage---Credits) from the community **@chrmarti**
- When done fixing/verifying and there are changes since last build at the end of day PT
  - [x] Build and manually release Insider from release/<x.y> for Code **@sandy081**
  - [x] Build and manually release Insider from release/<x.y> for vscode.dev (if there were vscode.dev candidates) **@sandy081**

##### Monday

- [x] Polish release notes **@ntrogh**
- [x] Schedule an endgame restrospective with with @sandy081, endgame buddy, and next @sandy081 for this week. [Retrospective template](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-internalbacklog/blob/main/.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/endgame-retrospective.md#L14)
- [x] Decide whether a [Patch Tuesday release](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-internalbacklog/wiki/Handling-MSRC-Cases#msrc--patch-tuesday-process) will happen:
  - Check the internal iteration plan for scheduled security issues (MSRCs) to determine if a Patch Tuesday release is needed.
  - If no Patch Tuesday release is planned, use the [Patch Tuesday E-Mail Template](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-internalbacklog/wiki/Patch-Tuesday-E-Mail-Template) to let the Updates team ([MDClientPatching@microsoft.com](mailto:MDClientPatching@microsoft.com)) know of that fact. Please cc Monacotools on this email as the client patching team has asked us to do so. **@sandy081**
  - Otherwise, if a Patch Tuesday release is necessary, start off a [Patch Tuesday Release plan](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-internalbacklog/wiki/Handling-MSRC-Cases#are-you-endgame-champbuddy) **@sandy081**
- [x] Remind the team: if they are going to be OOF for more than five days during the next iteration, assign someone to look out for critical issues in their feature areas and fix them if necessary. This helps with bug identification and fixing for recovery releases. **@sandy081**

##### Monday - Wednesday

- [x] [🔖milestone issues](https://github.com/issues?q=org%3Amicrosoft%20is%3Aopen%20is%3Aissue%20milestone%3A%22August%202025%22)
- [x] [🔖candidate issues](https://github.com/issues?q=org%3Amicrosoft%20is%3Aissue%20is%3Aopen%20milestone%3A%22August%202025%22%20label%3Acandidate)
- [x] Polish release notes **redmond**
- [x] Fix [`candidate` issues](https://github.com/issues?q=org%3Amicrosoft%20is%3Aissue%20is%3Aopen%20milestone%3A%22August%202025%22%20label%3Acandidate) (major bugs only)
  - Discuss and get approval in stand up
  - Review and merge into `release/<x.y>`
  - [Queue new auto-published insiders build](https://monacotools.visualstudio.com/Monaco/_build?definitionId=111) as candidates are merged **@sandy081** 
  - [Queue new Copilot Chat pre-release builds](https://dev.azure.com/monacotools/Monaco/_build?definitionId=489) as candidates are merged by manually running against the release branch **@sandy081**
  - Author of candidate PR should find verifier
- [x] Build but don't release stable for all platforms as new candidate issues come in **@sandy081**
- [x] Coordinate the official release timing with team and more specifically, team extension authors (ex: Jupyter and Copilot rely on VS Code release) **@sandy081**

> **Note:** The `Insiders` build needs to be in the wild for 24 hours before we can enter the last phase of the endgame, though the sanity testing step alone can happen earlier if there are no new candidates. **@sandy081**

##### Wednesday/Thursday - Expected release day (this may change)

- [x] Build stable for all platforms **@sandy081**
- [x] Manually run the [Copilot Chat stable pipeline](https://dev.azure.com/monacotools/Monaco/_build?definitionId=500) against the `release/<version>` branch **@sandy081**
  - Enable `Publish Extension`, you do not need an approval to build the VSIX.
  - **DO NOT** ask for approval for the extension publish step yet. This step should only be done 1 hour before VS Code core releases (see release plan for Wednesday/Thursday for more info).
  - If the simulation tests fail due to cache changes on `main`, you will need to specify running with the release branch of the cache. You can do this under "Resources" when scheduling the pipeline.
- [x] Sanity test Copilot Chat Stable
  - [x] VS Code RC **@benibenj**
    - [x] anyOS
  - [x] Codespaces Web using Insiders (Until CAPI supports Codespaces tokens natively. See [#6095](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-copilot/issues/6095#issuecomment-2289644474) for more information) **@dbaeumer**
    - We use Insiders because we cannot use Codespaces Web on core builds that are not released yet (even with custom query parameters in the URL).     
- Keep an eye out for any changes in the core RC (via candidates) that may require Copilot Chat to sanity test again on a new core stable build. **@sandy081**
- [x] [Sanity Testing VS Code Stable](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Sanity-Check)
  - [x] Windows 64 bit **@hediet** 
    - [x] System Installer
    - [x] User Installer

  - [x] Windows ARM64 **@hediet**

  - [x] Linux x64 **@aeschli**
    - [x] Archive
    - [x] DEB

    - [x] Snap
  - [x] Linux Server and CLI **@alexr00**  **@deepak1556**  _(can be tested from any OS with Docker)_
    - [x] x64
    - [x] ARM32
    - [x] ARM64
    - [x] x64 Alpine
    - [x] ARM64 Alpine
- [x] Release Copilot Chat **1 HOUR** before VS Code releases **@sandy081**
  - [x] Approve the `Publish` stage of the last [Copilot Chat stable pipeline](https://dev.azure.com/monacotools/Monaco/_build?definitionId=500) that's successfully sanity tested.
    - Note that there are __two__ steps that need approval to publish the extension to the marketplace.
  - [x] In `vscode-copilot-chat`, bump the engines.vscode version on the `main` branch to point to the next version. For example, from `1.81.0` to `1.82.0`. This ensures pre-release only runs on the latest insiders, which is necessary for proposed API development. Does not require the insiders to be released, only to be available on the builds page.
  - [x] In `vscode-copilot-chat`, run `npm install` to update `package-lock.json`
- [x] Manually release a new pre-release from main by running [the pre-release pipeline](https://dev.azure.com/monacotools/Monaco/_build?definitionId=489).
- [x] [Publish website](<https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-website?tab=readme-ov-file#publishing-a-website-change)>) **@ntrogh** **@sandy081**
- [x] Release stable from builds page no later than 11am PT **@sandy081**
- [x] Trigger the [[vscode.dev] 🚀 Deploy](https://dev.azure.com/monacotools/Monaco/_build?definitionId=276) pipeline from `release/x.y`, with the `prod` Deployment Target. ⚠️ Peer approval needed. **@sandy081**
  - [x] Request approval from another team member at the necessary step to deploy the vscode.dev build. **@sandy081**
- [x] Create an official release **@sandy081**
  - [x] Create a tag (make sure you pull the release branch first): `git tag <x.y.z>`
  - [x] Push the tag: `git push origin <x.y.z>`
  - [x] Create a GitHub release: [Open the GitHub tags](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/tags), and click far right `... > Create Release`. Use the correct title and description from our release notes. Also change the relative links for the key highlight list items to absolute links [Example](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/releases/tag/1.39.0)
- [x] X announcement **@pierceboggan**
- [x] Create and publish next release notes placeholder **@ntrogh**
- [x] Enable Continuous Release in the [Insiders builds page](https://builds.code.visualstudio.com/builds/insider) **@sandy081**
- [x] Release the latest Insiders build from the [Insiders builds page](https://builds.code.visualstudio.com/builds/insider) **@sandy081**
- [x] Trigger the [[vscode.dev] 🚀 Deploy](https://dev.azure.com/monacotools/Monaco/_build?definitionId=276) pipeline from `main`, with the `insiders` Deployment Target. **@sandy081**
- [x] [Publish @types/vscode](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Publish-vscode-types) if you find type diffs after running the steps **@sandy081**

Type: Bug I wanted to create my application in a multi container environment. The devcontainer configured in a 'Docker FROM Docker' (ie.the devcontainer controls the host's Docker instance frominside the devcontainer. The app and db container using the containers best suited for their roles. Copilot constantly mae wrong changes and gave invalid suggestions on this configuration, and continuously tried to force me into whatever environment it felt like it wanted to 'hallucinate' I tried being specific about the container I was referring to (devcontainer, app container db container) but it constantly got it wrong no matter what I tried ... it seemed to believe at times it was in a 'docker in docker' invironment and in doing so if it ran into an issue that was caused by that wrong assumption it woul djust go about reconfiguring my environment (incorrectly) breaking everything. What is the problem here? Am I doing soemthing that's not supposed to be done? Does no one else develp in a 'Docker FROM Docker' configuration? After using up a whole worth of month's worth of premium requests in few days just trying to write an application, about 1/10th of the premium requests were used on actual coding, the other 9/10ths were using on troubleshooting the problem copilot were creating by messing with the wrong containers for the wrong reasons. Now I'm o day 1 of new premium context and am almost 10% used and Copilot is still not giving me a comfortable feeling that it understand how bad it is performing. You need to create some 'storage' space for important context that copilot gets on every call (so I can explain to it the environment it is in and that it needs to verify the container environment it is trying to 'fix' before it 'fixes' it with broken configurations. title: test: chain of thought
body:
- [x] anyOS @aiday-mar
- [x] anyOS @Tyriar
- [x] anyOS @connor4312

Complexity: 4


[Create Issue](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/new?template=blank&body=Testing+%23264300%0A%0A&assignees=justschen)

---

## Context

Reasoning models have been found to be generally better due to structuring, and as GitHub models begin to provide reasoning, we wanted to create a first EARLY preview to what chain of thought will look like in VS Code. cc. @karthiknadig 

This is mostly checking to verify that thinking _can work_ end to end, from extension to UI. The UI needs a lot of fine tuning that we're unsure about due to how the models might respond. 

## Prerequisites (need to test both).

### GPT-5
- set the following settings:

```json
"github.copilot.chat.advanced.useResponsesApi": true,
"github.copilot.chat.advanced.responsesApiReasoning": "{ \"effort\": \"medium\", \"summary\": \"detailed\" }",
```
- reasoning effort can be modified.
- There is currently no model coming from GitHub that provides us the correct thinking deltas. However, GPT-5 (preview) _does_ provide thinking to some capacity. Team members should be feature flagged in.
- You'll notice thinking parts coming in chunks and long "working" times before thinking actually shows up, which is an upstream issue.

### BYOK
- To get the most accurate results, BYOK is your best bet. 
- From OpenAI (https://platform.openai.com/docs/models) you can select a model that has reasoning. Needs a $10 minimum balance. 
- I was using gpt-5-nano which is incredibly cheap and gives reasoning. 
- OR you can DM @justschen for an API key
- with BYOK open ai models, responses will actually be "streamed" in (like regular text).

unfortnuately, in my testing, there aren't any models that i found from [AI foundry](https://oai.azure.com/foundryResource/overview?wsid=/subscriptions/546ac631-883f-4fb4-bff0-b8639ed6e7c8/resourceGroups/justin-vscode-test/providers/Microsoft.CognitiveServices/accounts/justc-mf0nc6zz-eastus2&tid=72f988bf-86f1-41af-91ab-2d7cd011db47) (this is my deployment, but team members should have access) that have the right thinking deltas set up, hence, using OpenAI platform directly is best to test streaming. 

## Steps
1. Make sure you have your reasoning models set up. 
2. Ask chat a few questions. You can prompt it additionally with "Think really hard" or "Ultra think" or "make sure to think before replying".
3. Try it our with tool calls, with easy questions, code base search questions, and in general in your day to day.
4. Make sure to try the built in GPT 5 (preview) model and also a BYOK model.
5. Verify reasoning parts by setting your Log Level to `Trace`, and go to `Output` -> `Github Copilot Chat`. If you're not seeing reasoning, check to see if the model _actually_ gave us reasoning. 
6. Keywords to look for are "reasoning" or "reasoning_summary_text`

## Settings
- You can change the general rendering type via `chat.agent.thinkingStyle`.
- The default will render items uncollapsed until you get a non-thinking item.
- Try in the 3 different styles, and ensure that no thinking shows up with `none`.

## Things to Note
- There were initial mock ups to hide specific tool calls (ie, searches, reads, list dirs, and more) and group them _with_ thinking in the dropdown, but that will be tabled for when we get the right thing from GitHub...
- if you have any thoughts about the UI, i can take them into account, but the current UI will likely change 100%.

title: Layer breaker in `src/vs/workbench/services/assignment/common/assignmentFilters.ts`

labels.name: debt
labels.description: Code quality issues

labels.name: insiders-released
labels.description: Patch has been released in VS Code Insiders

body:
Layer breaker:

https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/9702bf9cd3fbdf457225a9eeda78bec5db27adf6/src/vs/workbench/services/assignment/common/assignmentFilters.ts#L13-L14

I think it should be possible to move `IChatEntitlementService` into `services` with some tweaks to its dependencies. Mainly:
* chat context keys we could split up between contrib ones and services ones
* dependency to extension workbench service: maybe we can lift that service up as well

title: Test: Empty state chat history
body:
Refs: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/251187

- [x] anyOS @mrleemurray
- [x] anyOS @nguyenchristy
- [x] anyOS @rzhao271

Complexity: 2


[Create Issue](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/new?template=blank&body=Testing+%23264269%0A%0A&assignees=eli-w-king)

---

We've added a chat history section to the chat panel empty state. This section shows up to three most recent chat sessions, and includes an entry point to open full chat history in command palette.

### Prereqs

1. Latest Insiders
2. Latest Copilot extension
3. Configure setting: `"chat.emptyState.history.enabled": true`


### Testing
**Verify chat history interactions in chat session empty state:**
- [ ] If there are more than 3 chat sessions, only the 3 most recent are shown
- [ ] If there are fewer than 3, only the available sessions are shown
- [ ] If there are none, the chat history section is hidden

**Toolbar changes:**
- [ ] In empty state: plus and history buttons are removed
- [ ] In an active chat session: plus and history buttons reappear
- [ ] The history button (on the right side of the section title) opens full chat history in command palette
- [ ] Sessions with long titles are truncated with an ellipsis
- [ ] Chat history section is responsive to panel size and aligns with the chat input box

title: Test: Chat editor improvements
body: refs: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/260227 - [x] anyOS @mrleemurray - [x] anyOS @nguyenchristy Complexity: 2 [Create Issue](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/new?template=blank&body=Testing+%23264266%0A%0A&assignees=osortega) --- ## Prereq 1. Latest VS Code Insiders 1. Latest _pre-release_ GitHub Pull Request Extension 1. Configure the VS Code settings: - `"chat.agentSessionsViewLocation": "view"` - `"githubPullRequests.codingAgent.uiIntegration": true` ## Context As part of the work to build a new centralized view to manage all chat sessions, we need to also make sure that users are able to interact with those chat sessions in a smooth way. For that, this iteration we worked on improving the way we present a chat session in a chat editor, adding actions for users to validate easier the changes done by the coding agents, improving the performance it takes for fetching a remote session such as copilot coding agent and other miscellaneous improvements. ## Steps The goal of this TPI is to do validate the improvements stated above. Steps: 1. Focus on the chat sessions view (`workbench.view.chat.sessions`) 2. Open the GitHub Copilot Coding Agents 3. Create a new coding agent task 4. Make sure progress and rendering is showing correctly 5. Open an already finished task or wait for the task to be done 6. Make sure all content is rendered correctly 7. Validate diffs and all actions in these section 8. Send a revision/comment on the chat for copilot to work on it again 9. Once it's done, make sure both iterations show up correctly 10. Lastly, make sure opening chat sessions in github copilot coding agent doesn't take too long and feels snappier than before

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->

<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: No

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 1.103.2
- OS Version: Windows 22H2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VS Code
2. Install  Extension Pack for Java (tested with 0.29.2)
3. >Maven:New Project
4. java17-basic-archetype
5. 1.1
6. Enter group Id
7. Enter Artifact Id
8. Select the directory

Error Message:
 *  Executing task: "mvn org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-archetype-plugin:3.1.2:generate -DarchetypeArtifactId="java17-basic-archetype" -DarchetypeGroupId="com.dominikcebula.archetypes" -DarchetypeVersion="1.1" -DgroupId="com.example" -DartifactId="demo"" 

The file name, directory name, or volume label syntax is incorrect.

The terminal process "cmd.exe /c ""mvn org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-archetype-plugin:3.1.2:generate -DarchetypeArtifactId="java17-basic-archetype" -DarchetypeGroupId="com.dominikcebula.archetypes" -DarchetypeVersion="1.1" -DgroupId="com.example" -DartifactId="demo"""" terminated with exit code: 1.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

It can be observed that there is an issue in how VS Code sends the instruction to CMD by adding quotation marks.
I have configured the settings.json file so that tasks always run in PowerShell, but this has not solved the error.

I have tested with VS Code version 1.102.3, and it works correctly without throwing any errors. This rules out possible issues with environment variables, spaces in the installation paths of Java and Maven, and everything in that regard is configured correctly.

title: Test: Chat sessions view
body: - [x] anyOS @ulugbekna - [x] anyOS @mjbvz - [x] anyOS @roblourens Complexity: 4 [Create Issue](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/new?template=blank&body=Testing+%23264256%0A%0A&assignees=osortega) --- ## Prereq 1. Latest VS Code Insiders 1. Latest _pre-release_ GitHub Pull Request Extension 1. Configure the VS Code settings: - `"chat.agentSessionsViewLocation": "view"` - `"githubPullRequests.codingAgent.uiIntegration": true` ## Context We are building a new centralized view to manage all chat sessions related to a workspace in a single location. This includes remote coding agents (such as github copilot) or local agents. This iteration we focused a lot on the E2E flow providing a nice UX for users to be able to coordinate multiple chat sessions at once and providing a better integration for users to validate and iterate over the changes. ## Steps The goal of this TPI is to do an exploration on the view itself, make sure things are working as expected and that all the actions and UX behind it makes sense. The ask here is that instead of following a specific set of steps or a specific flow is to work with the view for a bit and try out the integration with the actions. The list of features to validate: - Local chat sessions menu: - Focus on the chat sessions view (`workbench.view.chat.sessions`) - Create local chats (either + button or command) - Make sure the chat view is always visible in the list - Check the History node and review the chats there - Validate the context menu actions - Validate the action bar actions - GitHub Copilot Coding Agent menu - Install the latest GitHub Pull Request Extension pre-release extension - Focus on the chat sessions view (`workbench.view.chat.sessions`) - Make sure there is a GitHub Copilot Coding Agent provider - Go through the list of chat sessions, open them and interact with them. - Validate the context menu actions - Toggle `Show Rich Descriptions` on the Chat Sessions container view menu bar and validate information - Getting Started menu - Install extensions lets you search for recommended extensions - Learn more brings you to coding agent docs - Status dashboard - Kicking off any action in either a chat view, chat editor or any custom provider should reflect in the copilot dashboard on the VS Code menu bar. Validate we are reporting things correctly

title: Test Cross Cell Notebook NES
body: Refs: #255704 - [x] anyOS @joaomoreno - [x] anyOS @nguyenchristy - [x] anyOS @eleanorjboyd Complexity: 3 Authors @DonJayamanne [Create Issue](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/new?template=blank&body=Testing+%23264253%0A%0A&assignees=DonJayamanne) --- **Prerequisites** * Latest insiders * Latest pre-release of Copilot Chat extension * Enable and reload VS Code after updating the setting `"github.copilot.chat.advanced.notebook.alternativeNESFormat.enabled": true,` * Familiarity with Python and NES **Steps** * Create/open an existing Jupyter notebook * Make changes in cells such that you would expect to see NES suggestions in other cells * Assume you rename a variable and the variable is used in the next cell. * You should see an NES for the next cell * NOTE: Please remember the rules around NES in plain python files as well. * I.e. if you rename a variable in line 10, you wouldn't necessarily see a suggestion to jump to the next edit that is 150 lines down. *** I.e. the rules such as number of lines/boundaries for suggesting edits for regular text files applies here as well** If you expect to see some suggestions but do not get them * Verify you get the NES in a similar Python file (i.e. concatenate all Python cells into a single Python file and make the same edits & verify you get the NES) * While you are in the notebook and have managed to replicate the issue select the command `Github Copilot Developer: Report Notebook Next Edit Issue`, * create an issue using this and ensure it is assigned to @DonJayamanne * Optionally, click on `show` link next to `Include addtional extension info` * Copy all of the text and paste that into the issue (see below)

Decided to report it here because I've been able to use Claude via OpenRouter on other agentic tools on VsCode with the same API key. Example output: ``` view ``` **Steps to reproduce:** 1. title: Test: Migrating worktree changes into current workspace
body:
Refs: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/260708

- [x] AnyOS @anthonykim1
- [x] AnyOS @alexdima

Complexity: 2

Authors: @nguyenchristy @lszomoru 

[Create issue](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/new?assignees=nguyenchristy&body=Test%20for%20%23264242)


[Create Issue](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/new?template=blank&body=Testing+%23264242%0A%0A&assignees=nguyenchristy,lszomoru)

---

### Context
In the last milestone, we added worktree support, enabling users to check out multiple branches simultaneously. This makes it possible for agents to perform tasks in separate worktrees. In this milestone, we’re extending that functionality by allowing users to migrate all worktree changes back into the main repository.

### Prerequisites
1. Install the latest VS Code Insiders release.
2. Ensure the `git.detectWorktrees` setting is enabled.
3. Open a folder/workspace that contains a git repository.
4. Ensure that in the SCM view, 'Repositories' and 'Changes' is checked off, accessible by `... ` to the right of `Source Control`.

### Testing Steps 
1. In the main repository, create a worktree off of your current branch by accessing the `Create Worktree...` command from the Command Palette and then selecting `+ Create new branch...`.
2. Open the newly created worktree in a new window.
3. Make some changes in the worktree (reference **Merge Scenarios** for different cases to test).
4. For each scenario, call `Migrate Worktree Changes...` from the Command Palette in the main repository window.
5. Ensure the changes are applied to your main repository. If there are any merge conflicts, resolve them. 

**Merge Scenarios**
Changes could be modified, untracked, or deleted. 
- Make changes in the worktree, but no changes in the main repository.
- Make changes in the worktree and the main repository. If the changes in the worktree and the main repository modify the _same_ files, and the main repository's changes are unstaged, you should receive an error message. Otherwise, the worktree changes should apply. 
- Make changes in a worktree and the main repository that trigger a merge conflict.

title: Disable Space Key as a Commit Character for Suggestions in VS Code
body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->

Dear Visual Studio Code Team,I am a regular user of Visual Studio Code and greatly appreciate its powerful features and flexibility. However, I have encountered a limitation in the IntelliSense configuration that I believe could be improved to enhance the user experience.Currently, the editor.acceptSuggestionOnCommitCharacter setting controls whether commit characters (such as Space, comma, semicolon, etc.) accept suggestions. While this is useful, it applies to all commit characters collectively, and there is no option to disable only the Space key from accepting suggestions. This can be disruptive for users who frequently use the Space key for regular spacing but do not want it to trigger suggestion acceptance, especially in certain programming languages or workflows.I kindly request the addition of a feature or setting that allows users to exclude specific commit characters, such as the Space key, from accepting suggestions without disabling the functionality for other commit characters. This would provide greater flexibility and improve the editing experience for many users.Thank you for considering this request. I look forward to your response and am happy to provide further details if needed. Keep up the great work on Visual Studio Code!
Best regards.
